meanings.definition: Not easy; requiring great effort or skill to accomplish or comprehend.
meanings.sent1: Learning a new language can be difficult for some people.
meanings.sent2: The math problem was very difficult to solve.
meanings.sent3: It was difficult to believe that the cat could talk.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were a difficult puzzle to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The maze was so difficult that no one could find their way out.

meanings.definition: Not easily done, performed, comprehended, felt, etc.
meanings.sent1: Running a marathon is difficult for most people.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were difficult to follow.
meanings.sent3: It was difficult to imagine a world without colors.
meanings.sent4: The truth was a difficult pill to swallow.
meanings.sent5: The concept was so difficult that even the experts struggled to understand it.

meanings.definition: Hard to deal with or manage.
meanings.sent1: Difficult customers can be challenging for businesses.
meanings.sent2: The project proved to be more difficult than expected.
meanings.sent3: It was difficult to keep the mischievous puppy out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness made her a difficult person to reason with.
meanings.sent5: The storm was so difficult to control that chaos ensued.
